Yet the latest example of those impulses, "They/Them," illustrates how tricky that proposition can be, in a story that at various times feels creepy, exploitative and preachy, without becoming particularly tense or scary.

TITLE: 'The Sandman' finally fulfills the dream of adapting Neil Gaiman's acclaimed comic
SUMMARY: After years of failed attempts to bring Neil Gaiman's acclaimed and surreal comic to the screen, Netflix finally creates a home for "The Sandman," armed with enough top-notch British guest stars to populate a Harry Potter movie. The resulting series is visually striking but dramatically listless, made for those -- and maybe only those -- who already possess degrees in Sandman 101.

TITLE: Arrest in quadruple homicide after victims are found dead in fires at 2 homes in a small Nebraska town
SUMMARY: An arrest has been made in a quadruple homicide after the victims were found dead in fires in two homes, Nebraska State Police said Friday morning.

Rather, DeSantis summoned reporters and cameras for a midday media event, as he does several times a week, stood before officers in uniform and elected allies and matter-of-factly walked through his decision to kneecap a twice-elected Democratic official.

Even still, Newton-John rejected the tired "battle" narrative often used to describe cancer and approached her illness as a process of evolution.

TITLE: This key inflation measure fell, but remains painfully high

TITLE: Unexpected storms diverted 100 American Airlines flights and sparked hundreds of cancellations
SUMMARY: Severe thunderstorms around Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport on Wednesday caused 100 American Airlines flight diversions and led to hundreds of cancellations that extended into Thursday's schedule.

TITLE: This tried-and-true investing strategy isn't working
SUMMARY: If you are getting closer to retirement age...or if you're just a super conservative investor terrified of risky investments that may lose money...then you've probably heard you should have a 60/40 portfolio.

TITLE: Biden signs bill expanding health care benefits for veterans exposed to toxic burn pits
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden on Wednesday signed into law a bill expanding health care benefits to millions of veterans who were exposed to toxic burn pits during their military service.

TITLE: Opinion: Serena Williams is rewriting retirement, just as she has everything else
SUMMARY: Serena Williams was right to reject the word "retirement" in her recent essay in Vogue announcing that she would be moving on, "evolving," from tennis after competition in the US Open, writes Roxanne Jones. In this America, retirement -- from pro sports or any other job -- is not what it used to be, she says.

TITLE: Russia's war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: At least seven Russian warplanes were destroyed in explosions in annexed Crimea, satellite images show, in what CNN research found could be Moscow's biggest loss of military aircraft in a single day since World War II. Follow live news updates here.

TITLE: Feds seized documents from Mar-a-Lago in June with grand jury subpoena
SUMMARY: The FBI search at Mar-a-Lago this week came months after federal investigators served an earlier grand jury subpoena and took away sensitive national security documents from former President Donald Trump's property during a June meeting, people familiar with the matter tell CNN.

TITLE: Man arrested on suspicion of raping a US tourist in central Paris
SUMMARY: A 23-year-old man has been arrested following an investigation for suspicion of rape aggravated by drunkenness, the Paris Prosecutor's Office told CNN.

TITLE: An 'armed subject' tried to get into the FBI's Cincinnati office
SUMMARY: A stretch of Interstate 71 in Ohio has been closed off Thursday after a person attempted to gain entry into the FBI's Cincinnati office early this morning, according to authorities.

TITLE: Cognitive fatigue caused by work can impair decision-making. Here's how to fight it
SUMMARY: Does it feel like you don't have much control over the decisions you make after a long day of hard thinking? You are not alone. New research has shown the biological processes behind cognitive fatigue, and experts share what you can do about it.

TITLE: Trump invokes Fifth Amendment rights but swipes at New York attorney general during deposition
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump invoked his Fifth Amendment rights and declined to answer questions from the New York attorney general at a scheduled deposition Wednesday.

TITLE: Twitter activates election policy enforcement for US midterms
SUMMARY: Twitter will now label and demote misinformation about the upcoming US elections, such as false claims about how to cast a ballot or the outcomes of a race, as part of a broader set of content enforcement policies it's activating ahead of the midterms, the company said Thursday.

TITLE: McDonald's is starting to reopen in Ukraine
SUMMARY: After closing its restaurants in Ukraine six months ago because of the war, McDonald's is starting to reopen.

TITLE: At least 10 Republican nominees for state elections chief have disputed the legitimacy of the 2020 election
SUMMARY: In at least 10 states, the Republican nominee for the job of overseeing future elections is someone who has questioned, rejected or tried to overturn the results of the 2020 election.

TITLE: More than half of GOP governor nominees have questioned or denied the legitimacy of the 2020 election
SUMMARY: The Republican nominee in at least 20 of this year's 36 gubernatorial races is someone who has rejected, declined to affirm, raised doubts about, or tried to overturn Joe Biden's victory in the 2020 election.

TITLE: Biden to stay 'laser focused' on legislative accomplishments amid Trump investigations
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden doesn't plan to allow the investigations into his predecessor to muddy his efforts to tout a recent string of legislative achievements ahead of the midterm elections.

TITLE: Where state abortion bans stand amid legal challenges
SUMMARY: In more than a dozen states, legal fights are underway over abortion bans and other laws that greatly limit the procedure after the US Supreme Court ended a constitutional right to an abortion on June 24. On July 26, the Supreme Court entered its judgment in the case, taking the procedural step that will start the process for some states to implement their so-called trigger bans on the procedure.

TITLE: Man allegedly linked to ISIS 'Beatles' cell charged with terror offenses
SUMMARY: A man allegedly linked to an ISIS cell known as "the Beatles" has been charged with various terrorism offenses by London's Metropolitan Police.

TITLE: Sri Lanka's ousted former president Rajapaksa arrives in Thailand
SUMMARY: Former Sri Lankan president Gotabaya Rajapaksa has landed in Bangkok, according to a high-ranking police official with direct knowledge.

TITLE: Tourist rides moped around Pompeii
SUMMARY: An Australian tourist, 33, was caught riding a moped in Italy's archaeological site of Pompeii. He drove for over a mile on a dirt track around the ancient city walls.

TITLE: Patagonia's elusive species as you've never seen them before
SUMMARY: For the CNN docuseries "Patagonia: Life on the Edge of the World," scientists and film crews worked together to explore every corner of Patagonia's diverse ecosystems to capture rare species on camera, including shy Chilean dolphins and stalking pumas.

TITLE: The US Postal Service is raising rates for the holidays
SUMMARY: For the third year in a row, the United States Postal Service is hiking the prices of its delivery services -- but just for a few months.

TITLE: FTC weighs sweeping new rules on 'commercial surveillance' and Big Data
SUMMARY: The Federal Trade Commission is considering whether to write sweeping new regulations that could restrict how businesses collect and use consumer data, hinting at a possible crackdown on commercial algorithms and a sprawling economy powered by the personal information of millions of Americans.

TITLE: Attorney General Merrick Garland to speak Thursday afternoon
SUMMARY: Attorney General Merrick Garland will make a statement at 2:30 p.m. ET Thursday at the Department of Justice in Washington, DC.

TITLE: Britney Spears' lawyer in response to Kevin Federline​: 'We will not tolerate bullying'
SUMMARY: An attorney for Britney Spears is speaking out against a series of videos posted ​by the singer's ex-husband, Kevin Federline​.

TITLE: Authorities are in a standoff with an armed suspect who tried to enter the FBI's Cincinnati office
SUMMARY: Law enforcement officers are engaged in an "active standoff situation" with a suspect who authorities say attempted to breach the FBI's field office in Cincinnati on Thursday.

TITLE: Feds removed documents from Mar-a-Lago in June with grand jury subpoena
SUMMARY: The FBI search at Mar-a-Lago this week came months after federal investigators served an earlier grand jury subpoena and took away sensitive national security documents from former President Donald Trump's property during a June meeting, people familiar with the matter tell CNN.

TITLE: 'A League of Their Own' gets a makeover in an ambitious but uneven Amazon series
SUMMARY: Thirty years later, "A League of Their Own" receives a major makeover in a narratively ambitious but uneven Amazon series, providing timely filters on the World War II-era drama while dialing down the laughs. Specifically, the show considers what it was like to be a lesbian or Black during that period, operating along parallel tracks on a slow march through the season.

TITLE: The streaming wars are over
SUMMARY: In November 2019, Disney debuted Disney+, kicking off the so-called streaming wars and prompting companies across the media world to spend billions of dollars to launch services to take on Netflix.

TITLE: Political campaign emails can bypass Google's spam filters under a newly approved pilot project
SUMMARY: Federal election regulators voted Thursday to allow Google to proceed with a plan to make it easier for campaign emails to bypass spam filters. The action follow Republicans claims of political bias.

TITLE: The IRS is set to get billions for audit enforcement. Here's what it means for taxpayers
SUMMARY: The Internal Revenue Service is finally about to get the additional funding its officials have long been waiting for. The Democrats' Inflation Reduction Act calls for delivering nearly $80 billion to the IRS over 10 years.

TITLE: Your body may be pushing you to make worse choices after a day of hard thinking, study finds
SUMMARY: Does it feel like you don't have much control over the decisions you make after a long day of hard thinking? You are not alone. New research has shown the biological processes behind cognitive fatigue, and experts share what you can do about it.

TITLE: Merrick Garland says DOJ filed motion to unseal Trump Mar-a-Lago warrant and property receipt
SUMMARY: In his first public statement since federal agents searched former President Donald Trump's home at Mar-a-Lago earlier this week, Attorney General Merrick Garland on Thursday said that the Justice Department had filed in court a request that the search warrant and property receipt from the search be unsealed.

TITLE: First on CNN: Elaine Chao, Trump's former Transportation Secretary, met with Jan. 6 committee as other Cabinet members engage with panel
SUMMARY: The House select committee investigating January 6, 2021, has recently interviewed former Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao and is in talks with former Education Secretary Betsy DeVos as well as former National Security Adviser Robert O'Brien, multiple sources tell CNN. Chao and DeVos, both members of former President Donald Trump's Cabinet, resigned a day after the attack on the US Capitol and discussed invoking the 25th Amendment to remove Trump from power.

TITLE: Walgreens is paying signing bonuses up to $75,000 to pharmacists
SUMMARY: Pharmacists are in such high demand that Walgreens is dangling lucrative signing bonuses to fill open positions.

TITLE: United Airlines puts $10 million behind plan to shuttle customers by electric aircraft
SUMMARY: United Airlines gave a $10 million deposit to a startup developing electric aircraft — all for the goal of shuttling customers to and from the airport by air rather than gridlocked roadways.

TITLE: READ: DOJ motion to unseal search warrant and property receipt for Trump's Mar-a-Lago home
SUMMARY: Attorney General Merrick Garland on Thursday said that the Justice Department had filed a request in court to unseal the search warrant and property receipt from the search of former President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort in Palm Beach, Florida.

TITLE: Attorney General Merrick Garland speaks on FBI search of Trump's Mar-a-Lago
SUMMARY: Attorney General Merrick Garland is delivering a statement at the Department of Justice in Washington, DC. Follow live news updates.

TITLE: Investigators conclude five-year-old Harmony Montgomery was murdered in December 2019; Remains not located
SUMMARY: New Hampshire Attorney General John Formella says that investigators have concluded from biological evidence that Harmony Montgomery was murdered in Manchester, New Hampshire, in early December 2019. Formella says that the case is now officially a homicide investigation.

TITLE: CDC ends recommendations for social distancing and quarantine for Covid-19 control, no longer recommends test-to-stay in schools
SUMMARY: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says the nation should move away from restrictive measures such as quarantines and social distancing and focus on reducing severe disease from Covid-19.

TITLE: Anne Heche crash now being investigated as felony, police say
SUMMARY: Actress Anne Heche is now being investigated for felony DUI after crashing her car into a Los Angeles area home, which then caught on fire last week, according to police.

TITLE: Meta testing expanded encryption features amid renewed scrutiny of messaging data
SUMMARY: Meta on Thursday said it is testing expanded encryption features for Messenger and Instagram, days after the company came under scrutiny for providing messages to police in an abortion-related case.

TITLE: Opinion: How Democrats can persuade voters to turn out at the polls
SUMMARY: Our conscious mind is a limited tool for decision-making because it has limited "space," writes psychologist Drew Westen. Voters can't possibly process every issue they care about as they cast their ballots. Westen, a professor at Emory University, explains how Democrats can engage voters this campaign season with messaging that can maximize the party's outcomes at the polls.

TITLE: At least 21 protesters killed during anti-government protests in Sierra Leone, sources say
SUMMARY: Eight police officers were killed during violent anti-government protests in Sierra Leone on Wednesday, the country's youth minister told CNN Thursday, while hospital sources told Reuters that at least 21 civilians were killed in different locations in the country.

TITLE: Opinion: Biden's Afghanistan exit decision looks even worse a year later
SUMMARY: Peter Bergen writes that the US troop withdrawal from Afghanistan will long be seen as a defeat rather than a victory. The Biden administration now faces a policy dilemma in working to support Afghans without propping up the Taliban.

TITLE: Dozens injured in Legoland roller coaster crash in Germany
SUMMARY: A roller coaster crash at a Legoland theme park in southern Germany injured 31 people on Thursday, according to local authorities.

TITLE: 'Silent' spread of polio in New York drives CDC to consider additional vaccinations for some people
SUMMARY: A polio case identified in New York last month is "just the very, very tip of the iceberg" and an indication there "must be several hundred cases in the community circulating," a senior official with the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention told CNN on Wednesday.

TITLE: Cost of back-to-school essentials — glue, markers, pens, backpacks — has jumped
SUMMARY: As parents and teachers prepare for students to return to classrooms this fall, they're grappling with how much more the most basic school supplies will cost.

TITLE: To prepare for possible monkeypox spread, colleges focus on educating students
SUMMARY: With nearly 9,000 confirmed monkeypox cases nationwide, there is growing concern that US college and university campuses could become monkeypox "hotspots" this fall.

TITLE: Opinion: The problem Joe Manchin highlighted is crucial for America's future
SUMMARY: Oren Cass argues that the red tape to get building permits for climate-related projects hurts America and the environment. He says permitting reform should be a bipartisan policy and points to how Democratic Sen. Joe Manchin of West Virginia made a deal with his party to take on reforms and reduce paperwork.

TITLE: Standoff with an armed suspect who tried to enter the FBI's Cincinnati office has ended, officials say
SUMMARY: A law enforcement standoff with a suspect who authorities say attempted to breach the FBI's field office in Cincinnati on Thursday has ended, according to Clinton County Emergency Management Agency.

TITLE: Merrick Garland just called Donald Trump's bluff
SUMMARY: For the last 72 hours, since the FBI conducted a search of Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago home, the former President has spouted any number of claims about what happened and why. He's said that Democrats led the search (they didn't) and raised the possibility that FBI agents might have planted evidence, without providing any proof of the allegation.

TITLE: Five years later, Charlottesville pauses to reflect on deadly White nationalist rally
SUMMARY: On the five-year anniversary of a violent White nationalist rally in Charlottesville, Virginia, the city is pausing to reflect on the events of that weekend and hold several remembrance events in the coming days.

TITLE: Shell and Chevron shut Gulf of Mexico oil platforms after leak halts pipelines
SUMMARY: Shell and Chevron both said on Thursday that the companies halted oil production at several platforms in the Gulf of Mexico following a leak that knocked a pair of pipelines offline.

TITLE: Home prices hit a new record high in the second quarter
SUMMARY: Despite rising mortgage rates that dampened sales, home prices continued to climb higher in the second quarter, with many more cities seeing double-digit price gains than in the first part of the year.

TITLE: Timeline: The Justice Department criminal inquiry into Trump taking classified documents to Mar-a-Lago
SUMMARY: The federal criminal investigation into former President Donald Trump's potential mishandling of classified documents ramped up this week in significant and unprecedented fashion, with the FBI executing a search warrant at Trump's home at his Mar-a-Lago resort.

TITLE: Opinion: Here's how voters can be persuaded to turn out at the polls
SUMMARY: Our conscious mind is a limited tool for decision-making because it has limited "space," writes psychologist Drew Westen. Voters can't possibly process every issue they care about as they cast their ballots. Westen, a professor at Emory University, explains how Democrats can engage voters this campaign season with messaging that can maximize the party's outcomes at the polls.

TITLE: Clock is ticking for Biden to make key decisions on student loans
SUMMARY: With less than three weeks to go until the federal student loan repayment pause expires, millions of borrowers are still in the dark about whether President Joe Biden will extend the current payment moratorium or possibly forgive any of their debts.

TITLE: 'We have a problem': New ATF director takes agency's reins as country confronts a rise in violent crime
SUMMARY: The new director of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives took the agency's helm last month at a time when gun violence and extremism are on the rise, putting him among a handful of top federal officials tasked with preventing and responding to high-profile incidents of violent crime rocking the nation.

TITLE: Steve Martin doesn't want to retire, but he might slow down after 'Only Murders in the Building' ends
SUMMARY: Martin will be ready to slow down somewhat once his Emmy-nominated comedy wraps up, he told the Hollywood Reporter. But for a man who's been working for nearly all of his adult life, it's easier said than done.

TITLE: Senior Biden communications adviser departing White House
SUMMARY: Meghan Hays, a longtime communications aide to President Joe Biden, will depart her role as director of message planning at the White House later this month, CNN has learned.

TITLE: Investigators conclude 5-year-old Harmony Montgomery was murdered in December 2019; Remains not located
SUMMARY: New Hampshire Attorney General John Formella says that investigators have concluded from biological evidence that Harmony Montgomery was murdered in Manchester, New Hampshire, in early December 2019. Formella says that the case is now officially a homicide investigation.

TITLE: Tony Bennett Fast Facts
SUMMARY: View CNN's Fast Facts on the life of Grammy-winning singer Tony Bennett, famous for his signature song "I Left My Heart in San Francisco."

TITLE: New US monkeypox vaccine strategy could be huge boost for supply, but much is unknown
SUMMARY: To stretch the supply of the Jynneos monkeypox vaccine, federal health officials authorized smaller doses using a different method of injection. Yet efficacy data for the vaccine is not clear, and some experts argue that not enough is known about how the low-dose intradermal strategy might affect the protection it provides in the real world.

TITLE: CNN and other news outlets ask court to unseal entire court record related to Mar-a-Lago search
SUMMARY: CNN, joined by The Washington Post, NBC News and Scripps, asked a court on Thursday to unseal documents connected to the FBI search of former President Donald Trump's Florida residence this week -- including documents not covered by the Justice Department's own bid to unseal a selection of the warrant materials.

TITLE: An armed suspect who tried to enter the FBI's Cincinnati office is dead after standoff with authorities, officials say
SUMMARY: A law enforcement standoff with a man who attempted to breach the FBI's field office in Cincinnati on Thursday has ended with the suspect dead, according to the Ohio State Highway Patrol.

TITLE: From battlefields in Iraq to the Nashville music scene, how a Marine veteran is using art to heal
SUMMARY: Through immersive visual art and songwriting programs, Richard Casper's nonprofit, CreatiVets, has helped hundreds of combat veterans share their stories and work through their pain.

TITLE: Shell and Chevron shut Gulf of Mexico oil platforms after small leak halts pipelines
SUMMARY: Shell and Chevron both said on Thursday that the companies halted oil production at several platforms in the Gulf of Mexico following a small leak that knocked a pair of pipelines offline.

TITLE: Political ad spending is set to smash records in the 2022 midterms
SUMMARY: In every campaign, political ads become inescapable as Election Day draws closer. That may be more true than ever in this midterm cycle.

TITLE: Rivian losses surge to $1.7 billion as production ramps up
SUMMARY: Rivian said Thursday that it lost $1.7 billion in the second quarter of 2022 as it works to ramp up its vehicle production amid the on-going supply chain crunch. The automaker's losses more than doubled from the same period last year, when it lost $580 million.

TITLE: Former Virginia police officer sentenced to more than 7 years in January 6 case
SUMMARY: A former Virginia police officer who was fired after breaching the US Capitol building on January 6, 2021, was sentenced by a federal judge Thursday to more than seven years in prison.

TITLE: Man who allegedly threatened to detonate bomb near US Capitol to be released from jail
SUMMARY: Floyd Ray Roseberry, who allegedly threatened to detonate a bomb near the US Capitol almost one year ago, will be released from jail after a judge determined Thursday that he was suffering side effects from improper medication at the time of the incident.

TITLE: Vanessa Bryant leaves courtroom in tears during testimony about images taken at the scene of the helicopter crash that killed her husband and daughter
SUMMARY: Vanessa Bryant walked out of court Thursday afternoon during testimony that described images taken at the scene of the fatal helicopter crash that killed her husband, NBA legend Kobe Bryant, her daughter and seven others.

TITLE: Detailed accusations of Secret Service impeding Jan 6 investigation were scrapped from report to Congress
SUMMARY: A memo detailing how federal investigators believed the Secret Service was impeding them from obtaining key information about the agency's response to January 6, 2021, was significantly altered to remove reference to nearly all those efforts before a final report was presented to lawmakers in June.

TITLE: Yes, Biden politicized inflation data. That doesn't mean he's wrong
SUMMARY: Was July's inflation 0% or 8.5%? The answer is both. But leave it to politicians to skew this basic economic fact into rhetorical ammunition.

TITLE: Cause of Indiana house explosion that killed 3 and damaged 39 homes deemed accidental, authorities say
SUMMARY: The Evansville, Indiana, house explosion that left three dead and damaged at least 39 homes has been deemed accidental, Evansville Fire Chief Michael Connelly said Thursday afternoon.

TITLE: First on CNN: Elaine Chao, Trump's former Transportation Secretary, met with Jan. 6 committee as other Cabinet members engage with panel
SUMMARY: The House select committee investigating January 6, 2021, has recently interviewed former Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao and is in talks with former Education Secretary Betsy DeVos as well as former National Security Adviser Robert O'Brien, multiple sources tell CNN. Chao and DeVos, both members of former President Donald Trump's Cabinet, resigned a day after the attack on the US Capitol and discussed invoking the 25th Amendment to remove Trump from power.

TITLE: Sri Lanka's ousted former president Rajapaksa arrives in Thailand
SUMMARY: Former Sri Lankan president Gotabaya Rajapaksa flew by private jet from Singapore to Thailand on Thursday, according to a high-ranking police official with direct knowledge of his movements.

TITLE: Here's why the public owns Trump's presidential records
SUMMARY: That former President Donald Trump apparently tried to hold documents from his presidency away from the National Archives is completely unprecedented. As to why the public owns presidential documents, it's a relatively recent development that has roots in Watergate.

TITLE: Opinion: The vote you cast this November will be influenced by something you have little control over
SUMMARY: Our conscious mind is a limited tool for decision-making because it has limited "space," writes psychologist Drew Westen. Voters can't possibly process every issue they care about as they cast their ballots. Westen, a professor at Emory University, explains how Democrats can engage voters this campaign season with messaging that can maximize the party's outcomes at the polls.

TITLE: Man arrested on suspicion of raping a US tourist in central Paris
SUMMARY: A 23-year-old man has been arrested following an investigation for suspicion of rape aggravated by drunkenness, the Paris Prosecutor's Office told CNN.

TITLE: Judge revokes bond for man accused of shooting disgraced lawyer Alex Murdaugh in an attempted insurance fraud scheme
SUMMARY: A South Carolina judge revoked bond Thursday for Curtis Edward Smith, the man accused of shooting disgraced attorney Alex Murdaugh in the head last year in an alleged insurance fraud scheme.

TITLE: North Korea's Kim Jong Un declares victory against Covid
SUMMARY: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un declared victory in the battle against the novel coronavirus, ordering a lifting of maximum anti-epidemic measures imposed in May, state media said on Thursday.

TITLE: The Washington Post: FBI searched Trump's Mar-a-Lago residence for classified nuclear documents
SUMMARY: The FBI sought to locate classified documents related to nuclear weapons, among other items, when agents searched former President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort in Palm Beach, Florida, this week, people familiar with the investigation told The Washington Post.

TITLE: They survived lockdown in Shanghai, only to be trapped again in Hainan
SUMMARY: Chinese travelers fleeing lockdowns in the city found themselves in the same position on the beach resort island of Hainan.

TITLE: Cause of Indiana house explosion that killed 3 and damaged 39 homes still undetermined, authorities say
SUMMARY: The cause of the Evansville, Indiana, house explosion that left three dead and damaged at least 39 homes is still undetermined, Evansville Fire Chief Michael Connelly said Thursday afternoon.

TITLE: Seoul vows to move families from 'Parasite'-style basement homes after flooding deaths
SUMMARY: Seoul has vowed to move some of the city's poorest families out of underground and semi-subterranean homes after 13 people were killed in flooding caused by record-breaking rainfall this week, sparking public horror and calls for government accountability.

TITLE: Suspect in the killings of Muslim men in Albuquerque makes his first court appearance
SUMMARY: The man accused of fatally shooting two Muslim men in Albuquerque appeared in court for the first time Wednesday as investigators continued to search for a motive and probe whether he's connected to two other killings.

TITLE: Russia's war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: At least seven Russian warplanes were destroyed in explosions in annexed Crimea, satellite images show, in what CNN research found could be Moscow's biggest loss of military aircraft in a single day since World War II. Follow live news updates here.

TITLE: Account bearing name of suspect in Ohio standoff with FBI posted on Trump social media platform and encouraged violence against the agency
SUMMARY: A social media account bearing the name of Ricky Shiffer, the suspect in the Ohio standoff with the FBI, made a post on the social media platform founded by Donald Trump, referencing an attempt to storm an FBI office and encouraging others online to prepare for a revolutionary-type war.

TITLE: Anne Heche is 'not expected to survive,' family says in statement
SUMMARY: Anne Heche, who remains hospitalized after crashing her vehicle into a Los Angeles residence last week, is "not expected to survive," according to a statement from her family and friends shared with CNN by a representative.

TITLE: Investigators conclude 5-year-old Harmony Montgomery was murdered in December 2019. Her remains have not been located
SUMMARY: New Hampshire Attorney General John Formella says that investigators have concluded from biological evidence that Harmony Montgomery was murdered in Manchester, New Hampshire, in early December 2019. Formella says that the case is now officially a homicide investigation.

TITLE: More than 1 in 4 kids hospitalized for Covid or MIS-C have symptoms for months, study finds
SUMMARY: Nearly 30% of children who were hospitalized for Covid-19 or MIS-C, a rare but serious Covid-related condition, had symptoms more than a couple of months after their diagnosis, a new study found.

TITLE: Report that FBI sought nuclear documents sharpens Trump showdown with Justice Department
SUMMARY: A report that FBI agents searched for classified documents related to nuclear weapons at Donald Trump's Florida resort could explain the urgency of the unprecedented operation at the home of an ex-President and takes his showdown with the Justice Department to a grave new level.

TITLE: Opinions: How Democrats can persuade voters to turn out at the polls
SUMMARY: Our conscious mind is a limited tool for decision-making because it has limited "space," writes psychologist Drew Westen. Voters can't possibly process every issue they care about as they cast their ballots. Westen, a professor at Emory University, explains how Democrats can engage voters this campaign season with messaging that can maximize the party's outcomes at the polls.

TITLE: Suspect in killings of 2 Muslim men in Albuquerque is described as volatile by community members and police reports
SUMMARY: Muhammad Syed, the suspect arrested this week in connection with killings of two Muslim men in Albuquerque, New Mexico, had previous run-ins with authorities that included domestic violence arrests and had appeared volatile to others, according to police reports and CNN interviews with community members.

TITLE: New Hampshire school bus driver accused of stalking 8-year-old boy and his family
SUMMARY: A New Hampshire school bus driver was arrested and federally charged with interstate stalking, after he allegedly stalked and threatened an eight-year-old boy whom he regularly drove to school, according to a statement from the US Attorney's Office in New Hampshire.

TITLE: Ukrainian nuclear plant facing 'grave hour,' UN watchdog says
SUMMARY: The "alarming" situation at a Russian-occupied nuclear power plant in southeastern Ukraine had reached a "grave hour," the head of the United Nations' nuclear watchdog said Thursday, as he called for an immediate inspection of the facility by international experts.

TITLE: Hong Kong suffers biggest ever population drop as exodus accelerates
SUMMARY: Hong Kong has recorded its sharpest annual drop in population, with experts blaming the decline on strict Covid control measures and a political crackdown that have taken the shine off a financial hub long advertised as "Asia's world city."

TITLE: An armed man tried to enter the FBI's Cincinnati office and was fatally shot after a chase and standoff with law enforcement. Here's what we know
SUMMARY: An armed man suspected of trying to breach the FBI's Cincinnati field office on Thursday was killed after an hours-long standoff with law enforcement, authorities say.

TITLE: Timeline: The Justice Department criminal inquiry into Trump taking classified documents to Mar-a-Lago
SUMMARY: The federal criminal investigation into former President Donald Trump's potential mishandling of classified documents ramped up this week in significant and unprecedented fashion, with the FBI executing a search warrant at Trump's home at his Mar-a-Lago resort.

TITLE: Ecovado could be a greener alternative to 'green gold'
SUMMARY: Designer Arina Shokouhi has created an alternative avocado called Ecovado. Made from locally-sourced ingredients, it could help to reduce unsustainable avocado consumption.

TITLE: New Langya virus found in China could be 'tip of the iceberg' for undiscovered pathogens, researchers say
SUMMARY: More surveillance is needed of a new virus detected in dozens of people in eastern China that may not cause the next pandemic but suggests just how easily viruses can travel unnoticed from animals to humans, scientists say.

TITLE: Russia's war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: The situation at the Russian-occupied Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine has reached a "grave hour," the head of the UN nuclear watchdog said, as he called for an immediate inspection of the facility by experts. Follow live news updates here.

TITLE: A firefighter battling a wildfire in Oregon has died after he was struck by a tree, officials say
SUMMARY: A firefighter died while battling a wildfire in southwestern Oregon after he was struck by a tree, officials said Thursday.

TITLE: Opinion: 'Leaving my country was harder than losing my dad'
SUMMARY: This time last year, Zarifa Ghafari, Afghanistan's youngest female mayor, was about to embark on a terrifying journey to secure her -- and her family's -- lives. Now living in Germany, she looks back at a year since the Taliban takeover of her homeland.

TITLE: August 11, 2022 Russia-Ukraine news
SUMMARY: At least seven Russian warplanes were destroyed in explosions in annexed Crimea, satellite images show, in what CNN research found could be Moscow's biggest loss of military aircraft in a single day since World War II. Follow live news updates here.

TITLE: Look of the Week: Did Kylie Jenner channel another famous Kylie?
SUMMARY: This week, Kylie Jenner's glittering top drew comparisons to Kylie Minogue's outfit from her 2001 music video, "Can't Get You Out of My Head."

TITLE: Questions still loom -- more than two months later -- over Texas officials' ability to investigate the Uvalde massacre response
SUMMARY: As details about failures of the police response to the school massacre in Uvalde, Texas, have trickled out through leaks and incomplete official reviews, it's still not clear more than two months later to what extent any of the agencies involved are investigating individual and systemic mistakes in the response to the most deadly US campus shooting in nearly a decade.

TITLE: Account bearing name of suspect in Ohio standoff with FBI posted on Trump social media platform and encouraged violence against the agency
SUMMARY: A social media account bearing the name of Ricky Shiffer, the suspect in the Ohio standoff with the FBI, made a post on the social media platform founded by Donald Trump, referencing an attempt to storm an FBI office and encouraging others online to prepare for a revolutionary-type war.

TITLE: An armed man tried to enter the FBI's Cincinnati office and was fatally shot after a standoff with police. Here's what we know
SUMMARY: An armed man suspected of trying to breach the FBI's Cincinnati field office on Thursday was killed after an hours-long standoff with law enforcement, authorities say.

TITLE: Tom Brady taking leave of absence from Tampa Bay Buccaneers to 'deal with personal things'
SUMMARY: Tom Brady is taking some time away from the Tampa Bay Buccaneers to "deal with personal things," according to the team's head coach Todd Bowles.

TITLE: NBA to retire Bill Russell's No. 6 jersey throughout the league as tribute to the 11-time champion
SUMMARY: The National Basketball Association (NBA) announced on Thursday it will permanently retire Basketball Hall of Famer Bill Russell's No.6 jersey throughout the league.

TITLE: 'Moon Man' is just what China's box office needs after months of lockdowns
SUMMARY: A Chinese sci-fi comedy about an astronaut stranded on the moon has shattered summer box office records in China, providing much-needed lift to the world's second largest cinema industry that continues to grapple with Covid lockdowns.

TITLE: Argentina hikes interest rates to 69.5% as inflation hits 20-year high

SUMMARY: The captain of a San Diego vessel that sank in 2021 killing three of 32 smuggled migrants on board was sentenced to 18 years in prison Friday, the US Attorney's Office said in a release.

TITLE: Cost of back-to-school essentials — glue, markers, pens, backpacks — has jumped
SUMMARY: As parents and teachers prepare for students to return to classrooms this fall, they're grappling with how much more the most basic school supplies will cost.

TITLE: A Bad Bunny rant, an ex-governor in handcuffs and Puerto Rico still reels nearly five years after Hurricane Maria
SUMMARY: Puerto Rico teeters on the brink of yet another political crisis after the latest in a string of unrelated state and federal corruption cases against government officials, mayors, contractors and businesspeople.

TITLE: FBI investigating 'unprecedented' number of threats against bureau in wake of Mar-a-Lago search
SUMMARY: The FBI is investigating an "unprecedented" number of threats against bureau personnel and property in the wake of the search of Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort, including against agents listed in court records as being involved in the search, a law enforcement source tells CNN.

SUMMARY: After 15 years teaching second and third grade at Burney Elementary, a 350-student school 30 minutes outside Tampa, Emily Lee set up her classroom this month to welcome three- and four-year-olds for pre-K. It's a change she has embraced, she said, a chance to get kids on the right path in their educational journey from a young age.

TITLE: New species of giant deep-sea isopod discovered in the Gulf of Mexico
SUMMARY: A new deep-sea crustacean that bears a striking resemblance to the facehuggers from "Alien" has been identified off the Gulf of Mexico.

TITLE: W. Kamau Bell: The United States has broken this fundamental promise over 300 times
SUMMARY: This Sunday's episode of "United Shades of America" is about the Indigenous people of this land and how many of them are tired of being told where and how they can be on their land, writes W. Kamau Bell.

TITLE: Appalled, devastated and worried. How the world is reacting to the attack on Salman Rushdie
SUMMARY: Messages of outrage and support are pouring in from all corners of the globe after writer Salman Rushdie was stabbed at an upstate New York venue where he was due to speak Friday.

TITLE: Opinion: The Inflation Reduction Act is a huge victory in this existential fight
SUMMARY: But in a time when the twin, slow-moving catastrophes that are US politics and the global climate crisis make it so painful for so many of us to read the news, it's important to take a moment and celebrate when something good happens, writes Adam Sobel.

TITLE: State police recommend suspect in Salman Rushdie attack be charged with second-degree attempted murder and assault
SUMMARY: State police recommend Hadi Matar, 24, be charged with attempted murder in the second degree and assault in the second degree in the stabbing of author Salman Rushdie at a speaking engagement in western New York.

SUMMARY: State police recommend Hadi Matar, 24, be charged with attempted murder in the second degree and assault in the second degree in the stabbing of author Salman Rushdie at a speaking engagement in western New York.

SUMMARY: Song lyrics have changed throughout history and for a variety of reasons. And even though she appears likely to be voted out of her House seat, Cheney's political prospects have never seemed brighter, political writer Jodi Enda writes.

TITLE: Man accused of bringing weapons to vote counting center after 2020 election arrested for trespassing at US Capitol on January 6
SUMMARY: A man who is accused of bringing weapons to a Pennsylvania vote counting center after the 2020 presidential election was arrested Tuesday for allegedly illegally trespassing at the Capitol during the January 6, 2021, insurrection.

TITLE: Death Penalty Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read CNN's Death Penalty Fast Facts to learn more about capital punishment in the United States.

TITLE: First lady Dr. Jill Biden tests positive for Covid-19
SUMMARY: First lady Dr. Jill Biden has tested positive for Covid-19 and is experiencing mild symptoms, her spokesperson said Tuesday.

TITLE: American Airlines agrees to purchase 20 supersonic jets
SUMMARY: American Airlines is placing a bet on a future in which supersonic jets might return to the skies, shuttling passengers on some routes at speeds roughly twice as fast as current commercial aircraft.

TITLE: Stephen Breyer Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read CNN's Stephen Breyer Fast Facts and learn more about the life of the retired US Supreme Court associate justice.

TITLE: It's like Airbnb but for renting your pool to strangers. Things don't always go as planned
SUMMARY: Chris, a homeowner in Des Moines, was surprised when a woman he didn't know recently pulled into his driveway and asked if he could move his vehicles. She believed she had booked his pool for the night after someone had wrongfully listed it on a platform devoted to renting out private swimming pools. Within minutes of her showing up, he said, a few other cars arrived.

TITLE: Mick Jagger Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read CNN's Fast Facts on Mick Jagger and learn more about the singer, songwriter and Rolling Stones front man.

TITLE: Report: $1.9 billion stolen in crypto hacks so far this year
SUMMARY: A staggering $1.9 billion worth of cryptocurrency was stolen in hacks of various services in the first seven months of this year, marking a 60% increase from the same period in the year prior, according a report released Tuesday from blockchain analysis firm Chainalysis.

TITLE: What's in the Democrats' package on climate, health care and taxes
SUMMARY: The Democrats' budget reconciliation package, which contains several landmark climate and health care provisions, has been signed into law by President Joe Biden. Here's what's in the Inflation Reduction Act and what it means for you.

TITLE: Biden signs Inflation Reduction Act into law
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden signed a sweeping $750 billion health care, tax and climate bill into law at the White House on Tuesday -- marking a major victory for his administration and the Democratic Party ahead of the midterm elections.

TITLE: Watch the Artemis mega moon rocket roll out to the launchpad ahead of liftoff
SUMMARY: The Artemis mega moon rocket will roll out to the launchpad at NASA's Kennedy Space Center beginning at 9 p.m. ET Tuesday -- one of the final steps before the Space Launch System rocket and uncrewed Orion spacecraft launch on a journey around the moon.

TITLE: Judge rejects plea agreements from US Navy engineer and wife charged with conspiracy to sell classified information to  foreign country
SUMMARY: A federal judge in West Virginia rejected proposed plea agreements made between federal prosecutors and a US Navy nuclear engineer and his wife who pleaded guilty to conspiring to sell classified information to a foreign country in exchange for thousands of dollars in cryptocurrency.

TITLE: Former White House lawyers -- Cipollone and Philbin -- interviewed by FBI over Mar-a-Lago documents
SUMMARY: The FBI interviewed former White House Counsel Pat Cipollone and his former deputy Patrick Philbin earlier this year as part of the investigation into federal records taken to Donald Trump's Palm Beach home, two people briefed on the matter said.

TITLE: R. Kelly Chicago federal trial will revisit 2008 accusations that ended in acquittal
SUMMARY: Fourteen years after R. Kelly was acquitted of child pornography charges in Illinois, he is back in his hometown facing more federal charges that involve some of the tapes and victims from his previous state trial.

TITLE: Salman Rushdie is awake and 'articulate' after stabbing attack in New York, official says
SUMMARY: Award-winning author Salman Rushdie is awake and "articulate" in his conversations with investigators as he remains hospitalized for severe injuries following a stabbing attack in western New York Friday, a law enforcement official with direct knowledge of the investigation told CNN Monday.

TITLE: Tommy Dorfman said she would have transitioned earlier if not for '13 Reasons Why'
SUMMARY: Dorfman, who came out as trans last year, said she may have transitioned sooner if she hadn't been cast in "13 Reasons Why," in which she played a cisgender male, gay character.

TITLE: Opinion: It pays to be married
SUMMARY: It pays to be married. According to new data from the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis and reported in the Wall Street Journal, the financial gap between married couples and single people aged 25-34 has widened into a chasm, with married couples worth nearly nine times as much as singles. That's a big jump from 2010, when marrieds were still worth four times as much as singles.

TITLE: Russia blames sabotage as blasts rock another military facility in Crimea
SUMMARY: A blast at an ammunition depot in the village of Maiskoye in Crimea injured at least two people, local authorities said Tuesday, in the second incident in a week to rock the Russian-controlled peninsula.

TITLE: Uvalde school board to meet August 24 regarding district police chief Pete Arredondo's termination
SUMMARY: The fate of the Uvalde school district's police chief could be decided next week now that the school board has rescheduled a meeting to consider firing Pete Arredondo for August 24, the district announced Tuesday.

TITLE: Tasmanian tiger could be resurrected from extinction with ancient DNA
SUMMARY: Almost 100 years after its extinction, the Tasmian tiger may live once again. Using genetic advances, scientists want to resurrect the striped marsupial, officially known as a thylacine, which used to roam the Australian bush.

TITLE: Biden administration will stop buying Covid-19 vaccines, treatments and tests as early as this fall, Jha says
SUMMARY: The Biden administration has been planning for how to get past the crisis phase of the Covid-19 pandemic and will stop buying vaccines, treatments and tests as early as this fall, White House Covid-19 Response Coordinator Dr. Ashish Jha said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Australian rugby player Ellia Green becomes first Olympian to transition to a man

TITLE: Rockets strike near base holding US troops in Syria without causing injuries
SUMMARY: A number of rockets struck near a military base in northeastern Syria housing US troops on Monday night but did not cause any injuries, according to US officials and a statement from the US-led coalition.

TITLE: Florida judge to hold hearing Thursday on request to unseal Mar-a-Lago affidavit
SUMMARY: The federal magistrate judge who approved the Mar-a-Lago search warrant will hold a hearing Thursday at the court in Florida to discuss requests to unseal investigators' probable cause affidavit, which the Justice Department has opposed releasing.

TITLE: Solange will compose an original score for the New York City Ballet
SUMMARY: Solange, the singer whose work spans everything from film to fashion, will take her talents to the world of dance, composing an original score for the New York City Ballet.

TITLE: Watch NASA's mega moon rocket roll out to the launchpad ahead of liftoff
SUMMARY: The Artemis mega moon rocket will roll out to the launchpad at NASA's Kennedy Space Center beginning at 9 p.m. ET Tuesday -- one of the final steps before the Space Launch System rocket and uncrewed Orion spacecraft launch on a journey around the moon.

TITLE: Six weeks after getting shot at a Fourth of July parade, an 8-year-old left paralyzed feels 'hopeless' and angry as new reality sets in
SUMMARY: Before July Fourth, Cooper Roberts was almost always active and running around. He loved playing sports -- including soccer, baseball and football -- and riding his bike, his family has said.

TITLE: Tennessee authorities are investigating shootings that left 6 people -- including 3 teens -- injured
SUMMARY: Six people were shot early Tuesday near Methodist North Hospital in Memphis, Tennessee, hospital and law enforcement officials said.

SUMMARY: The immediate political future of Wyoming Rep. Liz Cheney, one of former President Donald Trump's most powerful critics in the GOP, is at stake on Tuesday as the last of the House Republicans who voted for his impeachment to face primary voters.

SUMMARY: Pennsylvania's Democratic governor on Tuesday moved to protect LGBTQ residents from conversion therapy, issuing an executive order that compels state agencies to discourage the practice and bans taxpayer funds from being used to support it.

TITLE: More water cuts as the US adjusts to the climate crisis

SUMMARY: Almost 100 years after its extinction, the Tasmanian tiger may live once again. Using genetic advances, scientists want to resurrect the striped marsupial, officially known as a thylacine, which used to roam the Australian bush.

According to new data from the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis and reported in the Wall Street Journal, the financial gap between married couples and single people aged 25-34 has widened into a chasm, with married couples worth nearly nine times as much as singles. That's a big jump from 2010, when marrieds were still worth four times as much as singles.

SUMMARY: Dakota Halverson is the brother of Marine Corps Lance Cpl. Kareem M. Nikoui.

SUMMARY: The Manhattan neurologist recently convicted of sexually assaulting, abusing and raping six of his patients died by suicide at Rikers Island on Monday, authorities said.

TITLE: 'Help is on the way': FDA finalizes rule that should usher in cheaper hearing aids
SUMMARY: Hearing aids should get cheaper and possibly even better due to a long-awaited rule change that the US Food and Drug Administration announced Tuesday.

TITLE: Tesla haters may have a new hero in the DMV

TITLE: Jury seated in Chicago federal trial for R. Kelly and two former associates, opening statements set for Wednesday

SUMMARY: With temperatures in parts of California expected to exceed 100 degrees Wednesday, Golden State residents are being asked to conserve electricity to ensure the power grid isn't pushed over the edge.

SUMMARY: Before July Fourth, Cooper Roberts was almost always active and running around. He loved playing sports -- including soccer, baseball and football -- and riding his bike, his family has said.

SUMMARY: Last week, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention announced key changes to its nationwide Covid-19 guidelines. Among them was the end of required quarantine after someone is exposed to a close contact with the coronavirus. The CDC also revised isolation guidance for people infected with Covid-19.

SUMMARY: The Syrian government on Wednesday denied it is holding or has any information on the whereabouts of Austin Tice, an American journalist who vanished a decade ago while reporting on the Middle Eastern nation's civil war.

SUMMARY: Travel experts say they expect the fall travel season to bring some relief -- in prices most definitely but possibly in flight disruptions, too. But we still have the rest of August and the Labor Day weekend to go.

SUMMARY: With lower gas prices effectively putting more money back in their pockets, Americans continued to spend last month, as persistent inflation reshapes shopping habits.

Trying to bend the mold is fine in theory, but the mix of sitcom-style tropes and gamma-irradiated powers yields a series that's too weak to smash much of anything.

Here's what you need to know as a consumer.

SUMMARY: Ye has come under fire for what's being described as a visual merchandising strategy at the Gap.
